segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit Filtering Platform Packet Drop, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events when packets are dropped by the Windows Filtering Platform.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit Filtering Platform Packet Drop, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events when packets are dropped by the Windows Filtering Platform.

segment.source: Audit Filtering Platform Packet Drop determines whether the operating system generates audit events when packets are dropped by the Windows Filtering Platform.
segment.target: Audit Filtering Platform Packet Drop determines whether the operating system generates audit events when packets are dropped by the Windows Filtering Platform.

segment.source: Windows Filtering Platform (WFP) enables independent software vendors (ISVs) to filter and modify TCP/IP packets, monitor or authorize connections, filter Internet Protocol security (IPsec)-protected traffic, and filter remote procedure calls (RPCs).
segment.target: Windows Filtering Platform (WFP) enables independent software vendors (ISVs) to filter and modify TCP/IP packets, monitor or authorize connections, filter Internet Protocol security (IPsec)-protected traffic, and filter remote procedure calls (RPCs).

segment.source: A high rate of dropped packets may indicate that there have been attempts to gain unauthorized access to computers on your network.
segment.target: A high rate of dropped packets may indicate that there have been attempts to gain unauthorized access to computers on your network.

segment.source: Failure events volume typically is very high for this subcategory and typically used for troubleshooting.
segment.target: Failure events volume typically is very high for this subcategory and typically used for troubleshooting.

segment.source: If you need to monitor blocked connections, it is better to use “5157(F): The Windows Filtering Platform has blocked a connection,” because it contains almost the same information and generates per-connection, not per-packet.
segment.target: If you need to monitor blocked connections, it is better to use “5157(F): The Windows Filtering Platform has blocked a connection,” because it contains almost the same information and generates per-connection, not per-packet.

segment.source: There is no recommendation to enable Success auditing, because Success events in this subcategory rarely occur.
segment.target: There is no recommendation to enable Success auditing, because Success events in this subcategory rarely occur.

segment.source: Failure events volume typically is very high for this subcategory and typically used for troubleshooting.
segment.target: Failure events volume typically is very high for this subcategory and typically used for troubleshooting.

segment.source: If you need to monitor blocked connections, it is better to use “5157(F): The Windows Filtering Platform has blocked a connection,” because it contains almost the same information and generates per-connection, not per-packet.
segment.target: If you need to monitor blocked connections, it is better to use “5157(F): The Windows Filtering Platform has blocked a connection,” because it contains almost the same information and generates per-connection, not per-packet.

segment.source: There is no recommendation to enable Success auditing, because Success events in this subcategory rarely occur.
segment.target: There is no recommendation to enable Success auditing, because Success events in this subcategory rarely occur.

segment.source: Failure events volume typically is very high for this subcategory and typically used for troubleshooting.
segment.target: Failure events volume typically is very high for this subcategory and typically used for troubleshooting.

segment.source: If you need to monitor blocked connections, it is better to use “5157(F): The Windows Filtering Platform has blocked a connection,” because it contains almost the same information and generates per-connection, not per-packet.
segment.target: If you need to monitor blocked connections, it is better to use “5157(F): The Windows Filtering Platform has blocked a connection,” because it contains almost the same information and generates per-connection, not per-packet.

segment.source: There is no recommendation to enable Success auditing, because Success events in this subcategory rarely occur.
segment.target: There is no recommendation to enable Success auditing, because Success events in this subcategory rarely occur.

segment.source: 5152(F): The Windows Filtering Platform blocked a packet.
segment.target: 5152(F): The Windows Filtering Platform blocked a packet.

segment.source: 5153(S): A more restrictive Windows Filtering Platform filter has blocked a packet.
segment.target: 5153(S): A more restrictive Windows Filtering Platform filter has blocked a packet.
